body:
I created a new VM on digital ocean and download the Graal CE 1.0.0 RC1. Getting following errors when trying to generate a native-image for my application jar.

* `gcc` not found. Had to install it manually.

```# graalvm-1.0.0-rc1/bin/native-image -jar secrets-cli-1.0.4-uber.jar
Build on Server(pid: 24973, port: 26681)*
   classlist:   8,541.74 ms
       (cap):     604.84 ms
       setup:   1,851.50 ms
fatal error: com.oracle.svm.core.util.VMError$HostedError: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "gcc" (in directory "/tmp/SVM-6654701256180913937"): error=2, No such file or directory
	at com.oracle.svm.core.util.VMError.shouldNotReachHere(VMError.java:68)
	at com.oracle.svm.hosted.c.codegen.CCompilerInvoker.compileAndParseError(CCompilerInvoker.java:83)
```

* `zlib` not found.

```[root@centos-7-sfo-01 ~]# graalvm-1.0.0-rc1/bin/native-image -jar secrets-cli-1.0.4-uber.jar
Build on Server(pid: 24973, port: 26681)
   classlist:   3,538.37 ms
       (cap):   1,873.92 ms
       setup:   2,165.85 ms
error: Error compiling query code (in /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c). Compiler command  gcc /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c -o /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives output included error: /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c:60:18: fatal error: zlib.h: No such file or directory
    C file contents around line 60:
    /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c:59: #include <unistd.h>
    /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c:60: #include <zlib.h>
    /tmp/SVM-7354486464663256205/PosixDirectives.c:61: #include <arpa/inet.h>
```

If these are the prerequisites for running `native-image`, it would be great to add this details to the documentation.
